When I called to place our order a miserable sounding me an answer the phone with the side and then said what do you need? I placed our order and he said don't come down here it's going to be at least an hour to we can get to you if my coworkers can do anything right. That was really unprofessional. Some people may think that character but really I don't care what kind of a day the person taking the pizza order is having I just want to place my order without feeling im bothering them,  You should know that you will have to illegally parked your car to pick your order up.  the place was filthy inside and it was packed full of people and total mayhem. I would never ever recommend eating in store even if the place was clean up you're still going to have people waiting to pick three orders of standing right over you. It was also about a hundred degrees in there. They also only take cash with they didn't mention and there was no sign so I was glad I had cash on hand.  I knew that something was up with the pizza 13 started leaking through the lid of the pizza as we were driving it home. The bottom and the top rated with grease. How does that even happen? My friend said that's a sign of a great pizza but he is a guy and we have other eating priorities it was disgusting. You're not supposed to take a slice of pizza up out of the pizza box and have all of the toppings slide off due to thebgrease.  the only restaurant that could get away with pizza that greasy is Vincents and they are now gone..you could caulk a bathtub with the cheese that's how rubbery it was. It was disgusting. the red sauce tasted like it was ketchup with sugar added. It was gross I don't understand why anybody likes this restaurant but the poor service and the poor quality of the food is a prime example of a restaurant resting on the laurels of its legacy.

QeL5DSmimHpxE_OfmUmGLQ.text: We are from Georgia and are in Pittsburg for a few days - we saw the reviews for Fiori's with several saying "best pizza in town" ( there were 2 others making the same claim but since Fiori's was closest we chose it) the pizza was absolutely delicious! I have never put cold cheese on a pizza before but we saw several others do it so we ordered some and tried it - it added to the experience. There was only seating for about 31 and the booths were pretty tight - we were planning to take the pizza back to our hotel but a table opened up. Usually when we are traveling we do not take leftovers back to the hotel but we definitely took the 3 slices left with us. This would be one of our favorite places if we lived anywhere near here.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

t3WiA4L1RofJLEzFxrBAeQ.text: The best pizza ever I have grown up eating this, I do see why people do  not love this place, the wings are amazing, try the pizza with meatballs on top

U_8cQo1F9rmOWch739F5lg.text: Best pizza in the Burgh... The cheese and the sweet sauce combo makes this pizza so delish. Don't get it by the slice, though-- they reheat it. It must be enjoyed HOT right out of the oven.

KGG1xOJ0i5_xPC4Q0fbWzA.text: A friend and I travelled to Pittsburgh for a haunted house.  I went on Yelp to find good pizza and the reviews said this was the best pizza in Pittsburgh!  I would have to agree.  It was amazing pizza! Completely lives up to all of the excellent reviews.

D0sDvLXSs6yYODIqK2haaw.text: Hands down the best pizza place in the Burgh. The sauce is sweet and the abundance of perfectly melted cheese goes perfectly with it. Their whole menu is great but I can't go there and not get pizza cause it's just too good to pass up!

E1vHZf8cLsbFwQJlxH8AtA.text: I literally don't even have words for my love for Fiori's. If I were stranded on an island and could only choose one food to have, it would be Fiori's pizza. That is all.

h5XRo_6QWkOE1yWzEY4dXQ.text: Solid pizza.  Interesting cheese blend, a healthy amount of toppings, good texture to the crust.  Nothing special here but it was good.  Small little place with possibly difficult parking (we got lucky).  Not anything better than any other good pizza I have ever had, but certainly not bad.

PmgF8Q71dBP-CIc7F4a22Q.text: Arguably the best pizza in the burgh. Very cheesy with a hint of sweetness to the sauce. Too messy and greasy for some, pizza nirvana for me. Their hoagies are really good too. They're huge. Hard to park but hey we'll give em a freebee on that one. 2 large one topping is around 37$. Not too shabby. Oh yeah, and their sausage is amazing!!!

HXRPexUNY9PylZqELH7uMg.text: Simply the best pizza. Hoagies, wings, and salads are excellent as well. This place is heralded as the best pizza in Pitt for a reason.

idPnX7z_oRhb-iF78_F4yQ.text: Always good. Would be nice if the center of the pizza was baked a bit more but overall really good. They are always busy but the staff stays very friendly.

uw8jGP3KH8iRTtFhg5Jqiw.text: Worst pizza and service I've  ever had anywhere .. the seating area was filthy. From condensation from the AC dripping in people's food to the filthy smelly rag used to wipe a table down..... pizza toppings were raw under ALL the cheese. Salad order was wrong and the owner was more worried about kissing the regulars ass's then hearing my complaints

8ULQ1iPccymQd3SON8xoRg.text: Fiori's is by far the best Pizza in Pittsburgh! I really don't know if much more to be said. This Pizza is one of the best I've had besides my own and I make a pretty good Pizza Pie. The location is small, and there isn't a lot of parking on the streets. But def worth it.

64U3TjN8JXdZYKYnWJnSPA.text: Definitely my favorite pizza place in Pittsburgh so far.  Tried a few pizza joints around the area but none had pizzas quite like Fiori's. This is a cool and casual place that serves New York style pizzas by the slice just the way I like it. The cheese was nice and stringy and you get plenty of toppings with each slice.  There's a few tables inside there but this is more like a fast food pizza joint. Great if you just want a quick slice to eat or getting take out!

F7FXC1uGHZu_EE-53AWypg.text: One of my favorite pizza places in town! When I first moved here it's actually all I kept hearing about and I can see why! Unfortunately they don't deliver but that's ok since they're open till late and serve such great pizza. Pizza I'm more than willing to drive to lol.

T1hp8g_kjSifCAD7_h4hRg.text: Everything about this pizza was perfect. But let me say that Fiori's has got the crust down. This is the best pizza I've ever had. I only wish they had one in Portland.

IpnMj2o5e1kHPCFL_PVGng.text: Fiori's is my favorite pizza of all time. If I were ever to leave Pittsburgh, Fiori's would be something I'd definitely come back for. Thin crust, sweet sauce, generous melty cheese....heaven to my tastebuds. It's also great cold! I can eat a Fiori's slice hot, cold, any time of day. Personally, the plain is my favorite but really, you can't go wrong with any of the toppings as long as you get the red sauce as your base. Fiori's also has a white pizza that I wouldn't mind having from time to time, but the red sauce is where it's at!  One downfall is that they don't deliver. It's a bummer, but it makes driving there to grab a pie all the more special. Another downfall is that it's located on the most annoying cobblestone hill with very limited parking, but man is it worth the trouble getting there!

photos.caption: Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pepperoni

l41Oo_L1IQ8sg4iuVqmm0w.text: This was my 2nd time here and it has been mediocre. We ordered the Italian hoagie, cheese sticks and slices of pie. The cheese sticks were good, no issues. The Italian hoagie needed more dressing and it was mostly bread. Everyone was saying that this is the best pizza but I lived here all my life and it was just "ok". The crust was a bit over cooked and the toppings was hardly cooked. It's like they cooked the pizza first, placed the toppings, then warmed them some more.  There was minimal sauce, so little that all I tasted was the crust and the toppings.  It wasn't the best I had and it wasn't the worst, just one of your run of the mill pizza joint.

d1S9XpllFwsCXyAhAPcTrA.text: Returning back to my city dwellings on Saturday after a week of vacation meant one thing--there was nothing in my fridge to eat (or at least wanted to eat). My dinner craving wandered around to pizza and never departed. I knew what I had to do. A quick call to Fiori's for a pick-up order while driving was a perfect solution and after a stop to Capital Ave to pick up my delicious oven hot pizza I was on my way home ready to devour. I was not disappointed, delicious!  Regrettably, I have not had Fiori's in many years (for shame, I know). Mostly laziness for pick-up (no delivery option) led me to other sub-par pizzeria's, or no pizza at all, for much too long. Upon relocating back to the city earlier this year I was bound and determined to reestablish my taste buds for the best pizza around, and nothing less would suffice. While I am an equal opportunity pizza eater, there is definitely something to be said for finding the kind of pizza that satiates your pizza cravings, in my case it's the basics--good crust, good sauce, and good cheese. Fiori's nails all three.

sVJkdwP2R201MGjs_w__Ow.text: Being from New York I am bit of a pizza snob. It is not that I won't eat pizza here but it is not NY. Unless you go to Fioris. This is True NY style pizza. Brings back memories of a big pie with foldable slices when I was in school on Long Island. If you want wood fired pizza this is not your place, but if you want authentic NY pizza, get a pie to honor grab a couple of slices and eat in.

sW50XLoetvbEyQ6E9W8QLg.text: Yesterday I've experienced a slice of Fiori's pizza for the first time after living in Pittsburgh for 4 years (yes, I know, shame on me for taking this long). So like holy shit! I want to use so many words to describe the texture, the flavor, the smell, but I don't think there are enough words in the dictionary for that. Simply wow! Maybe they use crack in their recipe. All I can think about is going back for more. I even had a dream about it last night

-VLw2vgg4ZdSseYjiv7p0w.text: I am from New York City / North Jersey ... Best Pizza in Pittsburgh hands down, in comparison to New York Pizza that I have tasted ... Sauce is on the sweet side just like the NYC pizza, Crust is thin, Cheese is whole milk mozzarella ...  I just wish they would make 8 cut slices like the NYC pizza ... I call Pittsburgh pizza slices pretzels sticks because the slices are so thin.  Also another down point is No DELIVERY

C6QFzc-19hm6TCs1Fzu7oQ.text: Honestly, this was just disappointing.  I was expecting great pizza.  Everyone raves about Fiori's so we decided to finally try it.  What we received was flavorless pizza.  Bland sauce and greasy cheese.  There was nothing great.  There was nothing even good.  My teenage daughter got rigatoni.  She said it tasted like spaghetti-o's.  Honestly it was just sad.  I love pizza.  Almost any pizza will at least make me happy...I mean, it's pizza!  But this...this is the first time I debated throwing away leftover pizza.  Nobody in our house likes it.  My husband hated it.  Our teenage sons weren't even happy with it.  There are so many good pizza options in the area.  This sadly is not one of them.

pzOFDNEIuHIwWr6sJcQ3lg.text: Definitely my favorite pizza in Pittsburgh! So good. The sauce is slightly sweet which ILOVE! The amount of cheese they use is great and the crust is perfect. I crave it constantly. My boyfriend loves the cold cheese on the side. They don't deliver which is understandable to me because they would be insanely busy and it would probably take forever for them to get things done win employees constantly driving deliveries. Staff is always friendly.

FJU3IjxX1A0jE9PgAiOUuw.text: Such a damn shame because the food is good but the people that work there absolutely suck!!!!! They are unorganized, shady, and unprofessional. Twice my order got messed up and It was no ones fault but the people that work there!!! Hopefully the boss can be a little more strict when hiring! But then again the owner has an attitude.... lost a good customer !

V2usL3pt5DB-CHc0LpyK3Q.text: I'll preface this by admitting that I'm a thin crust pizza snob. I'm originally from NJ and I've spent the last 4 years living in Pittsburgh being repeatedly disappointed by the pizza here. I had Fiori's for the first time tonight. I'm impressed. Thanks for bringing a little piece of home to the Burgh. Well done!

TKI5cROO1l7IabvNoyUIgg.text: This is my favorite pizza in the whole world ! I am constantly craving it and could probably eat it everyday! I like it so much I'm actually going it order one soon as I'm done with this review ! Consistently delicious and hot every time ! Five stars

ZfzPPHzJKQUFtf2WE4RnQA.text: Fiori's. My all time favorite pizza place. Oh, you have stolen my heart, since I was a child.   I recall memories with my family at my nana's house in Brookline, collecting pizza orders for dinner from my aunts, uncles, and cousins.  I always got to go pick it up with my aunt or my dad, sitting shotgun with the hot pizza on my lap. I remember, vividly, hearing "Don't tilt it! Keep it flat!" so the mounds of cheese wouldn't slide to one end.   This is my favorite pizza for several reasons: 1. The sauce is sweet and there's a LOT of it. 2. The sausage is meaty, fatty and has the perfect amount of fennel seed. 3. The crust is crunchy, and chewy, and the rest of the pizza is just flexible enough that you handle it (long enough for it to make it to your mouth without all the cheese sliding off!)   Though a little pricey for a whole pie, Fiori's is always worth it. I'm lucky enough that when I come home to visit there's usually always a Fiori's pizza on the stove.   Now the new trend (new for me) is to get a cup of cold cheese on the side, and top your slice with it while it's steaming hot. I think there's plenty of cheese on it already, so I usually don't get the cold cheese.  Hands down, this is the best pizza that I've ever had, and the best pizza in Pittsburgh by far.

PGck1NP4Lfx47quxlGuO5g.text: I've tried Fiori's 3 times thinking the third time has to be a charm. I've come to the conclusion that if you grew up eating this pizza and really didn't try anywhere else you'd like it, which apparently what a lot of Yinzers did since the 3 times I was there they were busy. The pizza is a bit dry due to lack of sauce and the taste of the sauce is pretty generic aka bland. On the positive side the cheese and crust are good. But calling it the best pizza in Pittsburgh is definitely a stretch. 3.75 stars.

RmJb4RoARbk5iowS0kia0A.text: My favorite Pizzaria in Pittsburgh! Nothing beats a slice at Fiori's. If you are visiting from out of town and are in the mood for pizza give it a try! Dine in or take out- no delivery.

xTv9Yf0T0TbJSOWyAOyQYw.text: Bland, nothing special sauce. If you like pizza just for the cheese, you'll love Fioris. There's lots of cheese. The crust is crisp, often burnt. The Italian sub we got had so little Italian dressing, it was more of a cold-cut sandwich. No bathrooms?!? If there is one, it's in the back, past the sign that says no entry, so not very public-friendly. No refills on fountain drinks, higher prices,  really cheap napkins good for nothing, and terrible on-street, on a hill parking round out this place. The only reason I gave them three stars is my husband liked it more than I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

GjmfbH_ws1NcZ8UBaoS8Ww.text: Dont get me wrong, I eat here occasionally, but I dont understand all the hype about this place. There is nothing spectacular about the food. They dont deliver and every time we go its packed like a can of sardines. I just agree to eat there when my husband wants it because he loves it so much... but this is coming from a man who doesn't have a very broad taste pallet anyway lol. His parents rave about it too, and to me it tastes average at best. It's alright but... meh... I could take it or leave it.

pXY6KmggkqxS4xSZxFacyg.text: The pizza here is good.   I don't know if I would say that it is the best pizza in Pittsburgh though as others claim. It is on par with most New York style home neighborhood pizzerias.   If you are in the area, stop by and try a slice and be your own judge.   We will definitely stop back through whenever in the area. Don't think it will be an out of the way destination though with other options around our neighborhood.   This place can get pretty crowded and parking is very sparse so make sure you have someone that can run in and pay while you either drive around or wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Everyone started to eat before I could get a pic of the whole thing.

bExs-R1V8QzF73KpT2RGuQ.text: Having been a regular here for years. Something to be said for a business that is in SUCH an inconvenient location and thrives.

unRu0gwltTZKlQModM-kfA.text: This place is super busy! Ordered a large half cheese half pepperoni and an order of 6 hot wings. The pepperoni half of the pizza had the pepperoni layered under the cheese, which was interesting. I felt like there was too much topping on the pepp half. I don't like the pepp to be overwhelming. But the sauce, crust, and cheese were all very good. Could have used a smidge more oregano or some sort of flavoring. The wings really knocked it out of the park. They were a good size, crispy, not too greasy, and had a very delicious sauce. The hot was hot enough to have a zing, but not so hot that they were inedible. Parking was a bit tricky, but if you're patient, there is a constant churn of people so you'll get a spot. There isn't a ton of seating inside but they do have several booths and tables. There are also some games to play (like pinball) while you wait. The workers are nice and seem to be fairly organized given how busy this place can get!

photos.caption: Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 6 hot wings
Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half cheese, half pepperoni (layered under the cheese)

3cWhdP8shwUP5Sx3BTkxYg.text: Fiori's pizza is proprietorial, for sure. Most people adore it, some not. I adore it.  It's 'NewYorkStyle' with a distinct flavour, ever-so-slightly on the sweet side, moderately heavy on the cheese, well done bottom - fold it in half and have at it. I make my own amazing pizza at home these days, but, if I want to splurge, I place a big take-out order at Fiori's, like I did for my birthday party last week. Pies, wings, hoagies, and salads - I called in a big order that night and they cranked it out, perfectly, without skipping a beat. It was sooo good! Reliably delicious, I've been eating Fiori's for 24 years.

gseFn4SDk8yGAVZV9Hc2Lw.text: Fiori's...simply the best pizza in Pittsburg!  We were heading home to St. Paris, Ohio from Niagra Falls and had to swing by Pittsburg just for pizza.  May fav is shrimp and mushroom, just amazing.  The crust is great and the sauce is just sweet enough to make...simply the best pizza in Pittsburg.

mBn4QhY8VAJL0V0tz6utzQ.text: Fiori's Pizza is so good! It is a very small little place if you want to eat in there but many people take pizza to go. The crust is like a sourdough like bread and it is so good. The sauce is a little sweet, the pizza is just amazing! It's very small in there and there are only like 3 booths, and 3 tables...in the evening it can get a little crowded inside from not only people eating in, but the people in line waiting to put their order in or picking up a to go order. Bottom line, I totally recommend getting Fiori's pizza.

Vt6tPFYUNhk9hGHW6KDZMA.text: I grew up eating from this shop. The quality of food is consistent, and it's always delicious. Workers are nice. Mr. Fiori is the best! My only "complaint" (which is not really one at all) is that the pizza can be a bit greasy. It tastes so good, though, that I hardly care.

slCjD5umcjnbGAtAGJhWMg.text: Best pizza in Pittsburgh, in my humble opinion ; )  It's cheesy and doughy w/ a sweet sauce...it's just all kinds of goodness!  Take-out is great, but eating there is fun, also.  Try the house salad, too - surprisingly good.  Parking can be an issue sometimes, but spaces usually open up quickly.

IRvdZwOQNdPd7OEi8QPZ1Q.text: We were in town for the US Open and found this restaurant via on the Yelp  the way to the hotel (it was maybe 10 minutes out of the way and well worth the drive).  The pizza was great.  The combination of sauce and cheese worked really well together.  Fiori's is now on my son's list as a must stop when in Pittsburgh.    He ranks it right up there with his favorite Hoboken pizza which says a lot.

Rnd3YM8tNEMMV3uFQB-xRQ.text: Since moving to Pittsburgh in November, I have made it my mission to find the best pizza joint.  It hasn't even been close.  Fiori's is the best.  I love the pepperoni pizza. It's perfect. Just delicious.

DF4AWQ_OSOVkxRTo81tkyg.text: There's little that needs to be said about Fiori's at this point. A local South Hills legend, it's pretty much perfection.  If a place can make me go to an ATM for cash (they don't accept cards,) that's a sign that it's GOOD STUFF! :)

-yf1JxRlbUIQoH9o_QEyUA.text: Best pizza in the Burgh and the Italian salad is amazing..The wings are great also..When ppl come in from out of town I make sure they have a Fioris pie before they leave

UuAHeavI8Zec7R9zu7EbMA.text: There are some great pizza places in this City, and this is one of the best. Good balance of quality ingredients, and crust is consistently finished. The  small interior can get crowded at times, but the pizza is worth the minor inconvenience. Easily on par with Aiello's and Mineo's in Squirrel Hill, two of the more decorated pizza joints in Pittsburgh. Fiori's gets extra credit for using the small spicy pepperonis and always having a pinball game in the corner!

62kz8ff50XNWrHH0ebsoAg.text: Good pizza . Not the best but good. Light years better than all the chains like papa johns/dominos/etc etc etc ... Delivery would be nice but I live close by so it's not a big deal to get there . The hoagies are so so . Good luck parking your car if you head here at night, especially. Seems to be a favorite spot for night-shift city cops to chow . Kudos to that old dude who is the owner for finally implenting debit/credit card payment ... welcome to the modern age ... ***man beaten/killed outside Fioris(seen on twitter) post-gazette.com/local/c... ***

RiEJpPngv8L4L6WxyV20Zw.text: To me pizza is pizza when it's ordered from these kinds of places. Each one has its special little touch but what people don't realize is the dough and sauce are what make the pizza taste different. Here you get a completely different taste from your everyday pizza and I think that's the drawing point. However I think it's a little over priced and not worth parking and getting from.   Place used to be a dump but since has fixed it up a bit. Good place to stop after a long night of drinks and bar hopping though, but just do pick up. The place will most likely be packed.

PDKe2XXfK74ocDnHVkp8Ow.text: I'm with Zachary on this one, after years of hearing about this pizza I finally tasted a slice at a steeler party. The sauce was normal, kinda sweet, garlicky, nothing special. Loaded with cheese that had pools of grease swimming on it. Knowing I don't eat meat my friends ordered me a half pizza with peppers and onions. It was still dripping with grease. I removed the cheese and just ate the crust with the vegetables. I was still kind of dumbfounded as to why this place gets raves. The crust was nothing to write home about, it was just kind of yeasty and chewy. I definitely don't see what all the fuss is. When I'm going to have a cheat day with pizza it's Beto's for me.

xYZHhvabuO7JgIUOGRYKAw.text: My favorite pizza in the city. Hoagies are also pretty good but the pizza takes the spotlight. One of the best places to shoot pool in the south hills next door, what more do you need?

eL2zkMQSKggOmozYEzxx8Q.text: Fiori's lives up to the hype that it has around Pittsburgh! Pizza is classic and delicious and I love that they offer cold cheese on the side which is a personal favorite for me! One negative, don't get extra cheese on your pizza if your getting it to go. By the time you get home it's very messy, but that being said it's still delicious!

RpbU8iwpafyEsFQISfArwQ.text: I've been eating Fiori's Pizza since the 1970's. I really like it. Their Italian salads, hoagies and other food is top notch as well. For the last eleven years , I've eaten at Fiori's at least one day per week for lunch since I worked close to that location. Like their motto says, "We fix you up". Nice people and great service.

iYMfKEl3vCJc143cHUDvTg.text: Excellent Pizza. We got the large with pepperoni, sausage and mushrooms. It was VERY busy on a Saturday night but we got our food in a reasonable time. I suggest ordering to go, seating can be limited. Will definitely come here again.

aTLtBhjOi_NQBEMCX57_YQ.text: I love this pizza. The crust is a thin crust. The sauce is slightly sweet. The servers are always friendly.

Ew6FHv3LGaeGrUNS6VTF7Q.text: These guys are AMAZING!  The food is great and everyone there is so welcoming and hospitable.  Went twice on my last trip in and each time the staff looked as though they really enjoyed themselves.

HDuV6oPLWd5X-jF3c2xwAg.text: Best pizza in the burgh. The pizza is out of this world  The salads are great  Their meatballs are fabulous  Garlic bread with cheese is delicious  1 of my 1st stops every time I'm in the burgh & if I don't bring pizza back to VA when I leave I hear about it from my friends People have complained about them only accepting cash they have an ATM machine on site & they have started accepting credit/debit cards for the last couple of months  Get a side of pasta sauce for the pizza  You'll thank me later

sjdFftARIV3GSm1mM4plsw.text: Folks gotta be kidding me here. The Fat Kid has eaten at MANY a pizza shop in this fair town and others, and I can say this with full confidence, that hands down, Fiori's is the best Pizza in the Burgh, and one of the best that has ever filled The Fat Kid's tummy anywhere.   The combination of things that Fiori's has in the pizza is what makes it special. A tremendous sweet sauce that still has a bite of tang to it when you get into it enough, the best crust ANYWHERE ( I believe Sprite is added to the crust or something of the sort to give it this flavor), tremendously thick, gooey, tasty cheese, it's fair share of grease (which ALL good pizzas MUST have, as eating pizza without grease is like drinking coffee without caffeine, it is just senseless), and excellent toppings when cooked in.   The Fat Kid usually will get his pie with Extra Cheese and Pepperoni, and this is by all means, the most fabulous of Fiori's combos, as the Roni's are always delish and the Cheese just makes the flavor of the Pizza swell and burst with intensity when it hits your palate.  Clearly, it is humorous to read some of the reviews on here, especially one's that endorse garbage Pizza like Krazy Brothers (Out Of Business), Vincent's (heavy and burnt and overgreasy), Molly's (cardboard dipped in vomit is better than a Molly's pie or most anything else from there, which is tremendously overpriced) are clear second-tier pies that just do not have the flavor to please an experienced palate like the Fiori's pie does.   Don't stop there though, the Cap and Cheese is tremendous, as is the Steak and Cheese sub, with a very nicely cooked hoagie bun that is both flavorful and of a fantastic texture, very similar to an old Latina Pizza hoagie (maybe the best Steak and Cheese in the Burgh at Latina's), and the sweet sauce that is put on this sub makes it one to die for. the Cap and Cheese is just a virtual monster of flavor, with a nice spicy kick.  Take it from The Fat Kid, when you come to the Buirgh, come to Fiori's. No one knows food like a Fat Kid, and you can lay safe money on that...

874uQq1eHFn5IFTa1JqWtw.text: They don't deliver, they don't take debit/credit, they don't advertise, and they've been in business more than 30 years.  That's enough to proof that its a top-notched well established restaurant.  They also happen to have Pittsburgh's best pizza.  Perfect sauce to cheese ratio, unique sweetness to the sauce, and a crust that's not too thick or too thin.  Just absoultely great pizza.

xfTSsopp4DAOEUZcQMmymA.text: I have just been there today (Monday) for the first time. I called and placed an order of 6 wings and a slice of cheese pizza for take out. When I got there 11:45 am the place was already packed. I told them I forgot to tell them I wanted garlic parm of wings  when I ordered.  They said if you don't choose  flavor they automatically make buffalo. That was  fine with me since it was my fault not mentioning it. They asked me if I could wait for 15 min while they re make my wings.  I didnt want to wait so I asked them to just add butter and parm on my wings which they kindly did for me. After I got home I opened the package. There were 8 PCs of wings. How sweet of them !!!  The pizza and wings were very good. I will definitely go  back to order my favorite garlic parm next time.

ieDzaH5WXMCUACSBXM8uqQ.text: I've enjoyed Fiori's pies, calzones and hoagies for almost 30 years sometimes 2 times a day. The dough is perfect and the sauce is remarkable. Parking can be a challenge but to go is always a good option. The Italian salad is also a tasty option. The best pizza ever.

JXCYvBflBqDY-FJmAufuJw.text: Best pizza in Pittsburgh hands down, and it's priced very fairly. The crust, sauce, and cheese all are 100% perfect.  I have other favorites in Pittsburgh but Fiori's is definitely my #1.  Besides their pizza, they also have excellent pasta and hoagies for a fair price.

zzbXQ-5laCdId74CC5Zf1A.text: Really don't get the high praise for their pizza. Great pizza has to have the three basics: sauce, crust and cheese all be great. Their sauce is so thin and tasteless. Their crust is maybe the only part that approaches great. The cheese is almost too much.

bmq77zIQPxFRPr1Mha3BHA.text: Hands down the best pizza in Pittsburgh. But parking absolutely sucks and I so wish that they delivered. But they're always busy. If you've never had Fiori's Pizza, try it.

7Wp9lWLiCZdSvLmRrbk53w.text: This is as close that you can get to the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle pizza that we all knEw and loved as kids. Let the pie cool down for 10 minutes before eating so the cheese is nice and sticky. Hands down the best pizza in Pittsburgh, seriously... 1/2 cheese, 1/2 pepperoni FTMFW!!!!!

bccRkzOEznjESHLlcHG3RA.text: This is some really good, cravable pizza, especially after an evening of delicious, and intoxicating spirits. Nothing fancy, just simply delicious pizza.

Q8fqauEalXe0gHj4qTZ7zA.text: I love this pizza. Great crust and sauce. Its one of a kind and could imagine any other pie.

VbIJEPvZglpm7YGlWI887Q.text: Love the food!!!!! Small place though, and no parking... Deffinately better than their second location but both are good!!!!

KJzm6vMGu6aHD7OJKTF2dw.text: What can you say about Fiori's. i'm going to just start throwing out some words and stop me when you get the point.   legendary, awesome, fantastic, sweet, cheese...oh so much cheese...., epic, beautiful, famous, iconic, local, unique, different, quality...... I think you get the point.   Fiori's is all of those things and more. They are, in my mind, the best Pizza place in Pittsburgh. I know that is a highly debatable topic, but when people from the North Shore bother to go to south hills to a little hole in the wall place with no parking and hardly any room to eat inside, you know it's good.   I lived in Brookline for 2 years and would frequent this place. I would say that eating the pizza in the shop is better than taking it out. Even though it's a small place it's worth it to go to that lightly crispy crust something you don't get when it sit's in a box waiting for you to pick it up.   Also the cheese is the cats meow at this place to don't even bother putting toppings on your pizza. The topping is overshadowed by the sweet sause and the mountain of cheese so don't waist your money. It's better that way, trust me!

3LQm2F58B3UJrMJxGQrUQA.text: Definitely one of the best pizza spots in all of Pizzaburgh.  They have a sugary sauce that goes well with their cheese.  I have eaten here several times.

HgCZxdjiaFRC2BFedoUc2Q.text: A city classic. Always consistent. Order cold mozz for a real experience. Great group of guys working behind the counter.

uZn6cxHG9yFuSGx8j05dyw.text: Never disappointed with anything from here. Pizza is the best in Pittsburgh, I do like Mineos but they are over priced.  Hoagies and wings are excellent at Fiores as well.

7DBTuGJ0qHOjfXghIbUhUA.text: Yummy!!!! We try a lot of pizza places in Pittsburgh...this by far has the best...the cheese pizza is perfect itself! I love the cheese and the sauce has a sweet taste!!! Only complaint  is the largest size is a large which is 10 pieces!

SU0JnI7Z1O1Jz4cXY12c9w.text: As far as pizza goes this is pretty, especially for it not being part of chain. (Ive become a bit of snob after working for one.) This place is small with lines that go out the door. Has a small sitting around with about 8 tables ;a fresh coat of paint wouldnt hurt this place. Menu has a lot to choose from with several toppings and sub sandwiches. The wait wasnt too long. The pizza itself is massive, about 16 in or little more. Not sure if I'd go out of my way to come back here. The hill the place is located on is killer! and there's practically no parking. But the pizza is pretty good. Very nice crust with just enough sauce and super cheesy!

8FhlJnJxOIvBIwiPb0g1sQ.text: This place is amazing. Not a better place to stop and grab a quick slice in the city. True NY style pizza. Best part is it's really cheap! I'm in and out for $5 every time. I wish they delivered!!

FOd5WUDBL8QosFAjlRFBGw.text: I wish I can leave 20 stars best pizza in Pittsburgh hands down just a bit greasy (note, if you are taking out keep the pizza level or the cheese will shift and get messy)

5wdQr0rc4PcCTOrtgikBfw.text: Best Pizza is Pittsburgh, probably in the country! I've been eating here all my life and when I moved away 7 years ago it was one of the things I missed most. Every time I come into town it is my first and last stops, and usually a couple times in between. I prefer plain cheese, it is so good, it doesn't need any toppings!

-iajs7_nIXhD-3KA50WTIQ.text: If they would deliver they would put all other pizza joints out off business in the south hills...it is that good. We are regulars :)

plt7dFjuIRzHGTak779Ckg.text: Excellent pizza. I have not made the trip out to Fiori's, but over this long weekend I decided to pick up a pie from Fiori's. So far, it is my favorite pizza in Pittsburgh. I ordered a sausage, mushroom, and banana pepper pizza.   There is a lot of cheese, but it is balanced out by the delicious, slightly sweet sauce. The crust has a nice chew and the toppings were flavorful. Great pizza!

bvxbL_o5-YnXbHh73i2ReA.text: This is tied for the best pizza that I have found in my journeys out and about in western Pennsylvania;  the other location is on the west banks of the Ohio in Monaca.  The crust is tasty and perfectly baked; a healthy amount of cheese is topped on the not-overly-sweet-but-tasty-nonetheless sauce; and thick slices of pepperoni adorn the top.  My only rub is that the bar next door is one of those in Pennsylvania that allows smoking; merely walking past the door rekindles childhood memories of my mother burning through her two packs of Winston's daily.

2bvb1PKoUx_3bsPi8mQx_Q.text: My boyfriend, a native pittsburgher introduced me to at least half a dozen city pizzas and Fiori's is in a 50/50 tie with my other favorite (which will remain anonymous). This is a pizza people can and should go out of their way for. It's in an unassuming building across from a gas station and can be easily missed but once you've eaten here, you'll begin craving it just by seeing the sign for Dormont. Parking can be quite difficult (I type this as I wait on a precariously steep hill waiting for my boyfriend to bring out our pizza) so keep that in mind if you're coming here with a group. A measure of a good pizza shop is how well they do up a traditional pepperoni and Fiori's does it well.

EeGoiyrjDvuCx4ZpDMFBVQ.text: Stopped in while visiting family. Calzone was the size of your head and filled with yummy goodness. I had an Italian cold cut and only ordered a half. I wouldn't have been able to eat an entire sandwich. That's a good thing. The half was the perfect size and very filling. We took half the calzone home and had another meal. Great food. Great value.

yyUwB6xwQk9uha8kvIcBpA.text: Outstanding pizza, and Italian food joint.  Never disappoints.

OmtvMrVPdz39V841w2vd4g.text: Being well aware of Fiori's reputation and not having had any for about 30 years I decided it was about time. I'll start by saying I am a huge fan of Mineos and it's still my favorite after my recent revisit with Fiori's. That being said, this was some damn fine pizza and I understand anew why it's is so beloved. The crust was fantastic , pep under the cheese , got a medium sausage ta boot .  Pretty good sauce (I like spicey and salty sauce, as opposed to sweet so this was really good all in all, if you never had Fiori's, it definitely lived up to its rep. And other than Mineos and Vincent's, definitely one of the best in Pittsburgh.

FFkVGBFjA34B9nt4jf-dZg.text: I came here for the very first time for lunch today.  I was told that being in the Burgh I need to come here.  Granted I have only been here for a few months from Chicago.  I am going to say, it is best pizza I have had in Pittsburgh thus far.  This is coming from someone who loves pizza and lived in Chicago.  We have some of the best and not that Deep Dish stuff but I digress.  This was a great slice not thick, not super greasy and really good. The sauce was fantastic and put it over the top.  Which I had from some reviews where it was "bland" I am not sure what they were eating but it was not from here.  The criteria for a good slice: 1. The Crust, this was perfect. 2. The sauce, this was very good. 3. Cheese to crust ratio: on point.  All in all, a great atmosphere and an even better pizza.

Us_r2iHtDRggDh3kdQZy0g.text: My first stop in Pittsburgh, I really enjoyed the food here. The cheese pizza was amazing probably some of the best I've had. The pizza I had with topping were just added on. Id prefer it to be cooked on the pizza instead. But I actually just slide them to the side and enjoyed the pizza. Also the wings were damn good and weren't tiny. Stop by for a cut or two.

7GH-uJRzPm3nwmS_-S8uHQ.text: Definitely the best pizza in Pittsburgh! Service is friendly and quick. I've stopped in to pick up a pizza and also ended up here many a night after being out in the Southside or downtown. Never any complaints about the quality of the food or the service.

kxDk0rGB33TUmII6CAxvQg.text: Amazing pizza! Fiori's sits on a stone path hill so it's best to park on the side of the building. There's only a few places to sit inside the restaurant. The person who took our order was very inviting and friendly.   After looking at how big the pizzas were, my fiance and I opted to share a small pepperoni pizza and it was delicious. Plenty of cheese on top so you'll see a cheese pull when picking up the slice. Being from Louisiana, I'm not used to the meat being under the cheese, but the spice of the pepperoni with the sweetness of the sauce made a tasty combination. There is a bit of grease on top of the pizza which we were fine with.   We also saw a lot of people getting the carton of Turner's Iced Lemon Tea and decided to try it. Although I'm not a fan of lemon flavored tea, this one is a must.   Overall, great taste and great pizza. Will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kqebfdcs0KUu93JFmkUbFw.text: How am I a Pittsburgher and I have NOT rated Fiori's pizza until now? Geeze!  Well, as many other yelpers have already stated, Fiori's is darn good pizza. Sweeter sauce, generous toppings, delicious crust.. it's a real treat. Although I wouldn't call it the best pizza in the Burgh, it's definitely up there and it never disappoints. We order it a few times a year and enjoy every bite. Now that they have a parking lot, there's NO reason to not give this place a try asap!

EwC0Qagety1_N4aOi-cvrw.text: In my opinion, the best pizza in our area. If I had to pick ONE pizza place in all of Pittsburgh to have, it'd be this one. It's so good. It's extremely greasy, but that's why I love it! Definitely definitely try it if you haven't

FsBjv_uV6s2UCZjJJMX8Eg.text: Best pizza in Pittsburgh, hands down! They have a unique sweeter sauce that is absolutely delicious!!!

vzL0w-Pm_z5C37mIwUp-AA.text: Fioris pizza is a staple to the South Hills. The sauce is mild and would appeal to most people. It is soo greasy though, like more greasy than any other pizza I've ever eaten and more greasy than I knew was even possible. Even after dozens of paper towels, I can still blot up more.   The employees are friendly and service is always good. We like supporting a small, locally owned business.   Parking is always high in demand so be prepared to walk.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wcdMmzTvhohDDl_ho_fTbg.text: Time stands still here. Have you ever wanted to relive the 80s? In a good way? Come here. Great music. Great service. No nonsense good Pittsburgh People.   I ordered a half pep half cheese. Their pepperoni is baked under the cheese so don't complain that you got ripped off before tasting.   The crust is magical. Even good pizza on the west coast is missing crucial components of True food magic. You can smell the dough down the street.   Great vibe, great pizza. I can't complain about anything.

ksQS_6KFJraUsrKsDgBioA.text: There's a reason they always get voted as best Pizza in the city and it's because they are...  delicious crust, slight sweetness to the sauce and plenty of cheese.  It was delicious, and I think I'll have another.

_ahZBhxgCO7R_D1NX-U3OQ.text: This is the same little pizza shop where they filmed the movies "Blind Fiori" and "The Fast And The Fiori-us." So make sure you grab a slice for your girlfriend, wife, sister, mother, daughter, Aunt or ant. Because hell hath no Fiori like a woman without pizza.  What to get: A slice with a pot of white cheese on the side Why: Because I just said the word "pot" and you thought of drugs and that says a lot about you Like in a bad way?: I'm not here to pass judgment, I'm just here to pass the ball to Antwaan Randle-El.  How to improve: Offer a range of different slices rather than just cheese.  I was fiori fiori impressed with Fiori's from the first time I tried it, over 10 years ago.  They're open super late at night, but coming here after 11pm is a little creepy, especially in winter. The roads in these parts are silent and dead. The towering hills blink down at you as you go through the tunnel or along the winding lanes. When you finally find this little spot, on a steep cobbled side street that leads up to nowhere, it's next to a dive bar and a silent gas station. You might see the Pittsburgh version of a tumbleweed blow by. Be brave and head on in for the best slice in town.  It's the kind of pizza that, if it were on the other side of a river, you'd take a fiori across just to get it.  To this day, it remains the only Pizzeria that calls itself a Pizzaria, in my experience. It's also the best slice in Pittsburgh, a little ahead of Aiello's, Pizza Italia and Fazio's, which are 3 other similar slices, which complete the "quadfecta" of the best slices in a town that has very unique pizza.  Einstein knew all about this pizza. It's where he came up with his Fiori of Relativity.  It's unique in how bland and plain and simple it is. It's all about the extra-floury extra-white dough, and the small amounts of sauce and conservative layer of cheese. It actually works though. No other city makes pizza like Pitt, and when I'm in town I rarely miss the opportunity to enjoy one of these slices of heaven.  This was the first slice in space (Fiori Gagarin), so that in itself is a reason to try it.  I heard a long time ago that you should ask for a pot of white cheese on the side. They don't seem to be too familiar with the concept, but they gladly do it and it's pretty cheap. The white cheese is yum, and goes well with the already cheesy, slightly-dry pizza. I recommend getting a drink with your slice.  Also, full disclosure: I often get this pizza for a girl to try and seduce her. It's my form of Fioriplay.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fi fi fo yum. I smell the sauce of a pizza slice.
Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. That clock is redder than my head when I&#39;m worked up
Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fiori &amp; Loathing in Las Vegas

mRtwDKh5oQnI-VXCaoQaFw.text: Double crust: Just when I thought Fiori's couldn't be any better, somebody told me to order my pizza with a double crust, or thick crust. It's just too good to describe in words. It's not super thick like Sicilian, but you definitely have a thicker crust than the regular Fiori's pizza, which is totally delicious on its own.  The rivalry for best Pittsburgh pizza typically gets booked as Mineo's versus Aiello's, but Fiori's in Dormont is hands down Numero Uno. Here's why- The sauce is seasoned, slightly sweet, and applied in perfect proportion. The cheese is top quality, and again applied in perfect proportion. The toppings are top-quality, again applied in perfect proportion. But really the ultimate deciding factor is the crossed-which is far superior to any other pizza crust in Pittsburgh.  Why my emphasis on proportions? Because Mineos puts up so I would pound of pizza cheese on their large pizza, it's no jokes nearly a quarter of an inch of pizza cheese. Aiellos (my number 2 choice because of their garlic sauce) marinara sauce is just too sweet.   Also the Italian salad at Fiori's is delicious. Definitely worth getting to accompany your pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Fiori's Pizzaria - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Get the double crust.

MVpKb1Q_cP1swmhnm02MzA.text: Amaaaaazing pizza  and friendly staff.  Wanted a cold cut sandwich, but passed, as they don't have pickles LOL  This is a must eat in Pittsburgh!

oIbsmijbcagaEowO5S0ydA.text: Second time in Pittsburgh and Fiori's is a must before I leave. Great pizza and garlic bread!

Yc0V5ncN0dgHMhpfx7M45A.text: Awesome pizza.  Italian hoagies are good too.    If you haven't tired their pizza you should it won't disappoint.    Little costly for the pizza but you get what you pay for and it is worth it.

lDWaPpo1tVdX4yXmd_0f7A.text: This place has been hyped up to me for a while, and I have to admit it definitaley lived up to the hype.  The pizza is cooked hot and fresh.  It is cheesy, delicious, and savoyery.  It is easy to make a mediocre pizza, but to take it to that next step of memorable, it takes some special deliciousness, and this place took it to that next step.  I could easily see myself going out of my way to eat this pizza again.  Also, the staff was very friendly, and the atmosphere of this place is the perfect setting of a local, classic pizza joint.    Go here, enjoy the pizza, come back for more.

B3tS_QHVdfjhTzPE1MbSdg.text: The best pizza in the burgh! I was raised form New York and a very particular taste for pizza. While this isn't new York style it is very good. The only one that rivals the taste is Pizza Sola. The crust is thin and the cheese is creamy. It has a great flavor. My only problem is that it's cash only! It's the 21 century get with the program!

YW2_OGd8sILecNAvLTXaZQ.text: This pizza is amazing!!  I am from Chicago and very picky about pizza. When my boyfriend brought me here, I was not expecting much but wow was I wrong.  This pizza is so good! The crust is always cooked perfectly and there is tons of cheese.  It's a must have every time we are back in Pittsburgh!

dJcxdIZFGK8wb10CHWa_Dw.text: As a Colorado native transplant and Bronco fan, this is the real deal.....New York style in da burgh. the little hole in the wall Bar next door owns Fiori's as is way cool. You can bring your Pizza over and have a cold one while you watch local yokels in Steelers t-shirts play pool and talk about past glory's gone by!

64doFuuH9BHbwxK0vWemSA.text: Best pizza in the city, hands down. You might have to stand and eat it, but it is definitely worth it. The staff is always so nice and inviting, service is always fast. perfect crust, sauce is a little sweet, but I'm not complaining, and there is enough cheese on these pies to clog your arteries for the next 50 years. The best, the best, the best.

l0zfRc3ifGOg2EIL-TqJEA.text: Hands down the best pizza in Pittsburgh. I suggest eating in, as this pizza is at it's best when it's piping hot.  I swear they've had the same gents working there since I've been going for over 15 years.

lFaaSrdcxM72Qw6X4HOVGQ.text: One of my favorite pizza places! Pizza, fries and hoagies all good here. Love the buffalo sauce on the side as well.

KDMWFzvxeC_nOZ1pSSR49A.text: First time trying them out since moving to the area. Ordered some hot wings for pick-up, which were very good! I will go back!

ygUoVQeO4Y9_x0WXxdVJpw.text: If your from Pittsburgh and have never had Fiori's shame on you (especially if your from the South Hills). I don't need to elaborate, as everyone else already has. The only beef I've ever had with them is that they don't deliver!

nLBI8ferqbsF54tPlLyWGg.text: Best Fu*king Pizza in Pittsburgh. Do yourself a favor and try this. FYI. Cash only. But they do have an ATM

c2kHUQmUSMggrUvEytDbhw.text: I'm pretty sure this is my favorite pizza in Pittsburgh. I'm so sick of pizza chains and pizza made on conveyer belts. Luckily, Fiori's still makes old school pizza that tastes great.  As others have said, the sauce is a little sweet. I personally think the sauce is what makes this pizza so good. The crust is thin and always baked to perfection and is never soggy.   On top of great pizza, Fiori's hoagies are some of the best around. My favorite is the Italian with banana peppers.   The only downside to Fiori's is the parking. It can be frustrating at busy times. Although parking can be tricky, don't let this stop you from eating an excellent pizza.

dKsIinrzz7bqC5WTbUZlxg.text: Excellent Pizza that lives up to the reputation. The cheese was delicious and toppings were hearty. Looking forward to ordering Fiori's again!

L7eOxaKYXfb45fHgl-0ftw.text: A basic place but the food is good and service is also, limited wine and beer

aCUE35_uG8ZU9SsygaGGjw.text: Pizza is pretty good esp with a side of cold cheese. This is a must-stop place for us whenever we are in the area.   Downsides are: they don't accept cards (should use the square reader if anything), parking is horrible and the interior is small & crowded if you wanted to dine in.

2O3NrIIFhPvX573bahD28w.text: The pizza is super greasy but it really is some of the best. Most cheap pizza in Pittsburgh tastes like cardboard and everyone seems to like it. Fiori's is actually worth tasting. I don't have to put toppings on it in order to stomach eating it- that's the True mark of a good pizza! The sandwiches are decent as well, but I've never tried the pasta or any apps. Large plain cheese pizza is my favorite here.

YtIVr1yuVwfdyFLLdxWUxQ.text: I am new to the area and looking for that one pizza place that I fall in love with. After reading the reviews I thought this may be it, it's not. First off parking is impossible which isn't a huge deal. I ordered a pizza and an Italian sausage hoagie. The pizza is a hot  mess. You open the box and that's what it looks like. Just thrown together with no care at all. I love cheese but the amount of cheese they put on is ridiculous. I guess they do this to cover the taste of the non existing crust. This pizza felt like I was eating a pound of cheese mixed with sauce. The pizza is a 1.5 stars max.  The Italian sausage I really enjoyed. Again way to much cheese. Seriously, what's the deal with all the freaking cheese! Anyways the sausage  had a great texture and taste to it. Just the right amount of peppers and the hoagie was soft and had a great feel to it. I give it a 4.  I may give the pizza another try. It was a Friday night, they were very busy and maybe just rushed. I will probably go back to try the other hoagies.

YX3pBLkPUde30bqd_pw78Q.text: Simply the best! Good prices good food and friendly staff. Never a bad slice of pizza there.

1SOqPgvXFielf-R2pIQocA.text: Definitely the best pizza I have ever had in my life. I've eaten plenty of pizza. Nothing compares to fioris. I would absolutely recommend this place.

KrPpLVjh7MiOSrNIDKDVUA.text: Saw all the great ratings so I ended up checking this place out on two separate occasions during the evening. Bought two slices of pizza on the first go-around and two subs on the second go-around. Not really getting what the hype is about concerning their pizza since it tasted ... just like any generic pizza. Cheese was gooey, sauce was alright, crust was not too thin or thick ... essentially right in the middle of the mill. They definitely do have good subs/sandwiches that are worth getting though.

BdA4YYo3xHU10Iu7dCgzkQ.text: This gets a rare 5 star rating for pizza because it's the city's best in my opinion. Great ingredients and a unique experience.   The two major criticisms I have are the business takes cash only and the owner isn't very nice when you question the presentation of the pizza.  On one unique occasion I arrived home with my pizza on the passenger seat only to see the cheese slid all the way off the crust. I drove less than half a mile given I was located right near the Cadillac dealership. A must go in Pittsburgh, but the location gets a 7.9/10 strictly off of the grease and the owner.

OIO7Dv4zNhusygkOVjFeog.text: Our pizza had potential but it was almost like eating raw dough! Cheese tasty, nice not too sweet sauce but thin limp doughy crust ruined it.  I hate places that cut corners when they are busy.  It's also the type of pizza that would be better ate in the restaurant, becomes greasy, soggy, congealed cheese within a 10 min ride home.

5n1b9-_WKTUcpudXyX-axA.text: I heard that this was the best pizza in Pittsburgh, and I was eager to see if it lived up to the hype. It did. The crust, cheese, sauce... all excellent. Definitely one of the best pizzas I've ever had.

wGr8qUhfu96JEfLhjX_gyw.text: when we lived in PGH we came here often. It is our fav in PGH & almost anywhere . We visit PGH and always take home 2 large pies when we fly back home in vegas. GR8 crust, sauce, very generous toppings and ample cheese. A superstar pizza!

mkTh4GZaP_AyAfxULXVLQg.text: I had my first ever Fiori's pizza last night, and I must say that I wasn't impressed.   Many people have said that this is the best pizza in Pittsburgh. I feel like the pizza didn't fit the hype. Now don't get me wrong, the pizza was good. But nothing about it put it above all other pizza shops in the Burg.   The pizza was averagely decent and they don't deliver.

i0YU_J2uRf1Sr6a_XytS6Q.text: This is hands down the absolute best pizza in Pittsburgh, and that's really saying something because Pittsburgh has some great pizza places. Their pizza is amazing-- it's not fancy, and a little bit sweet, but truly the best pizza you can buy in the city. Their calzones are similarly amazing.  My parents used to go to Fiori's when they were dating, and even now it's one of their favorites. They moved out to Boise, Idaho a few years ago, but every time they're back in the 'Burgh Fiori's is the first place we stop, if that tells you anything. Apparently, it's just as good now as it was when it opened in the 70s.   Do yourself a favor and stop in. Plus, they redid the parking lot pretty recently, so it's easier than ever ;-)

vLdV4cN7WYULIYQG11f5Bg.text: It's national pizza day so doing a pizza search on Yelp, decided this would be the place to try as I've ears great things about it.  There's something about small "hole in the wall" type of restaurants and this is a gem of a pizza joint. Parking is on a hilly, cobblestone street, or a private lot off the main road. Tonight was a busy night with limited seating. They have a decent amount of seats but seems they do a lot of takeout orders. If dining in, order at the counter and take a seat. Even though they were slammed it only took about 20 minutes for my large pie, and I could have waited double that for this delicious pizza. Definitely one of my favorites, plenty of flavor and tasty hand tossed dough makes this better than most. Service is attentive and friendly. They have a good menu selection not just pizzas but calzones and hoagies as well.  I'll definitely be back again to support small business and this locally owned business.
